episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the history of thatched phone booths in Eastbourne, the migration patterns of dinosaurs, the use of incubators for premature babies in amusement parks, and the ancient origins of the middle finger gesture as an insult.

facts.fact: From 1925 until 1936, the town of Eastbourne had two phone booths with thatched roofs.
In the first half of the 20th century, thousands of premature babies were treated in amusement parks and fairgrounds in Europe and the United States.
Giving someone the finger has been an insult for 2,300 years.
